input2:
Mr. ___ is a ___ yo man with history of diet-controlled HLD, tobacco use, obesity  and migraine who presents with 3 days of loss of peripheral vision on R and headache. Mr. ___ was in his usual state of health after working overnight ___ night, until 1100 ___ am. He then had onset of headache, and noted a bright light in his right field of vision at onset, which he states is typical for his migraines.The headache continued, and he complained to his wife later in the day about a problem with his peripheral vision on the right. 

His headache, and peripheral vision loss in the right continued through the day ___ and ___.  His wife notes that he slept much of those past 3 days. Mr. ___ said he felt 'out of it', and his wife said that he seemed distant, and dismissed her questions. He presented today to OSH ED due to continued headache.  There were no new symptoms that prompted presentation. OSH ED noted L PCA distribution infact on CT and transferred patient to ___.
input3:
migraine with aura
obesity
Seasonal allergies
Bladder cancer dx'd incidentally ___ year ago, s/p resection, no
chemo nor radiation. Was told it was found very early.
History of diverticulitis
Patent foramen ovale (dx during hospital stay)
input4:
Mother passed away from CHF
Father living, diagnosed with A. fib at age ___

WOB

Neurologic Examination:
- Mental status: Awake, alert, oriented to self, 'hospital' but not which, stated ___. Able to relate history with mild difficulty. Mildly inattentive, with MOYB he names each month slowly and skips ___ before self-correcting unprompted. Speech is fluent with normal grammar and syntax. No paraphasic errors. Naming intact to low frequency words. Repetition intact. Reading intact. Comprehension intact to complex commands. Normal prosody. Able to register 3 objects at 30 seconds and recall ___ at 5 minutes, ___ with category clue, ___ with MC. No evidence of hemi-neglect. 

-Cranial Nerves: PERRL 3->2. Dense R homonymous hemianopsia. 
EOMI without nystagmus. Facial sensation intact to light touch. Face symmetric at rest and with activation. Hearing intact to conversation. Palate elevates symmetrically. ___ strength in trapezii bilaterally. Tongue protrudes in midline and moves briskly to side.

- Motor:  Normal bulk and tone.  Subtle right pronation without downward drift.  No tremor nor asterixis.
